iceberg noun
(SALAD)
[ C or U ] (also iceberg lettuce) a kind of lettuce (= a plant with large, green leaves, usually eaten uncooked) that is very crunchy (= making a loud noise when it is eaten): Iceberg lettuce has become the most popular kind of lettuce, despite having very little taste. She made a salad of peppers, avocado, and feta cheese, mixed together with iceberg lettuce. Synonym
crisphead
More examplesFewer examplesCan you pick up some iceberg and a cucumber when you go shopping, please.The lettuce used in burgers is almost always iceberg, because it adds a pleasant crunch.
